nodes.bodyText: access should be package level not public.
this constructor is not user facing right? then it should not be public.

Its not even used for now :)
I just added it as it made sense to add something with FeedOptions as parameter for constructor. I will change the public type to package-private.

aren't we going to have two options class types? now it is not clear if continuationToken is set in FeedOption and also passed by 'CosmosContinuablePageFlux.byPage(continuationToken)' who overrides who.

nodes.bodyText:
I agree with the confusion as "who overrides who".
We don't need to necessarily split them. Since continuationToken is used internally from feedOptions class, which we don't need to change.
I think a better solution here would be to hide public setter of continuationToken and maxItemCount. So that end users would have to go via byPage(continuationToken, pageSize) route to set them up, and internally we can copy them to feedOptions, and keep things as it is. We will not have to change the business logic for these.

nodes.bodyText:
some questions:

Aren't we going to split the options as discussed earlier?
can you please run a perf benchmark with and without this PR using this benchmark, and see how different the numbers are?
#6771


Regarding options, let's discuss that offline.
Regarding benchmark, I will run them today and will post the numbers here.

nodes.bodyText:
each of the reactor transformation will have its own internal buffering, we need to make sure after the transformation, we fetch limited number of items/pages, and possibly configure how many pages should be pre-fetched.
We should have some tests similar to BackPressureCrossPartitionTest and BackpressureTest on the surface query API.
Not necessarily in this PR. but we need to have that.
Sure, will add those. Thanks for the suggestion.
@moderakh Added back pressure tests for subscribe call on CosmosContinuablePagedFlux object.

I only see this is used in the implementation of CosmosContinuablePagedFlux but not exposed in the public surface area
as it is in com.azure.cosmos is it used in the public surface area?
